Group colors used for Farris data

Source: R/farrisdata.r
colorSub.Rd

Group colors used for Farris data

colorSub

Format

character vector of R color names, named by the experiment factors, sample groups, and boolean values TRUE and FALSE.

Details

The colorSub object is simple a vector of colors, named by the experimental factors, the sample groups, and boolean TRUE and FALSE.

Examples

data(colorSub);
print(colorSub);
#>           CA1           CA2           CA3            DG            CB 
#>      "orange"  "orangered3"  "dodgerblue"      "purple"      "grey75" 
#>            DE        CA1_CB        CA1_DE        CA2_CB        CA2_DE 
#>      "grey30"     "orange1" "darkorange2"  "orangered1"  "orangered3" 
#>        CA3_CB        CA3_DE         DG_CB         DG_DE          TRUE 
#> "dodgerblue1" "dodgerblue3" "darkorchid1" "darkorchid3"     "skyblue" 
#>         FALSE 
#>  "indianred3" 

# Split into a list, just for visualization
colorSubType <- ifelse(grepl("_", names(colorSub)),
   "Group",
   "Factor");
colorSubL <- split(colorSub, colorSubType);
if (require(jamba)) {
   showColors(colorSubL);
}
#> Loading required package: jamba
